articles.description: When the Spanish flu ravaged, nurses had no protective equipment and cared for sick patients in the city’s slums. How the deadly outbreak shaped today’s fight.
articles.content:
Melbourne was the Australian epicentre of the Spanish flu outbreak in 1919, and a small band of district nurses were forced to change their methods to help our city's poorest people survive the pandemic.
Some of those changes stuck and remain today as Victor… [+7515 chars]

articles.title: Three words behind Australia's success | CQ News - CQ News
articles.description: The four countries worst hit by COVID-19 share a classification by the World Health Organisation that “we don’t want”, an Australian epidemiologist says.
articles.content:
When COVID-19 reached Australian shores, the country acted quickly.
